### initialize() {#a434c328cc87725efcfb56d78ca310e56}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;OpenMPOpt.cpp&#125;::AAExecutionDomainFunction::initialize (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor">Attributor</a> &amp; A)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Initialize the state with the information in the Attributor <code>A</code>.

This function is called by the Attributor once all abstract attributes have been identified. It can and shall be used for task like:
<ul>
<li>identify existing knowledge in the IR and use it for the &quot;known state&quot;</li>
<li>perform any work that is not going to change over time, e.g., determine a subset of the IR, or attributes in-flight, that have to be looked at in the <code>updateImpl</code> method.</li>
</ul>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/openmpopt-cpp/#l02698">2698</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/openmpopt-cpp">OpenMPOpt.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isExecutedInAlignedRegion() {#a6d53d8df2e0ea40eee8a7349563a9df7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;OpenMPOpt.cpp&#125;::AAExecutionDomainFunction::isExecutedInAlignedRegion (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor">Attributor</a> &amp; A, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &amp; I) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Check if the instruction <code>I</code> is executed in an aligned region, that is, the synchronizing effects before and after <code>I</code> are both aligned barriers.

This effectively means all threads execute <code>I</code> together.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/openmpopt-cpp/#l02835">2835</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/openmpopt-cpp">OpenMPOpt.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Helper function to determine if <code>FI</code> is a no-op given the information about its execution from <code>ExecDomainAA</code>.

  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Hook for the Attributor to trigger the manifestation of the information represented by the abstract attribute in the LLVM-IR.

\\Return CHANGED if the IR was altered, otherwise UNCHANGED.

### mergeInPredecessor() {#a6d1d88ed623962b62576733b8f474655}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;OpenMPOpt.cpp&#125;::AAExecutionDomainFunction::mergeInPredecessor (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor">Attributor</a> &amp; A, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/aaexecutiondomain/executiondomainty">ExecutionDomainTy</a> &amp; ED, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/aaexecutiondomain/executiondomainty">ExecutionDomainTy</a> &amp; PredED, bool InitialEdgeOnly=false)</>}>
Merge all information from <code>PredED</code> into the successor <code>ED</code>.

If <code>InitialEdgeOnly</code> is set, only the initial edge will enter the block represented by <code>ED</code> from this predecessor.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/openmpopt-cpp/#l02816">2816</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/openmpopt-cpp">OpenMPOpt.cpp</a>.
